qas.question: What organization is often seen as a great power in addition to member counties?
What other tools are used as alternative to military force?
How many great powers are members of Europian Union?
What summits does EU have membership?

answers.text: WTO and at G8 and G-20

plausible_answers.text: in the functional spheres of trade and diplomacy

qas.question: Where does Europe use its military dominance?

plausible_answers.text: has limited scope in the areas of foreign affairs and defence policy.

qas.question: As a supranational union, what are the UK's limits?
How many great powers are members of the WTO?

plausible_answers.text: WTO and at G8 and G-20 summits

qas.question: At what summits does Germany have representation?
In what area is the WTO exclusively competent?

context: With continuing European integration, the <a0_0>European Union<a0_0/> is increasingly being seen as a great power in its own right, with representation at the <a3_0><b7_0>WTO and at G8 and G-20<a3_0/> summits<b7_0/>. This is most notable in areas where the European Union has exclusive competence (i.e. <b8_0>economic affairs<b8_0/>). It also reflects a non-traditional conception of Europe's world role as a global "civilian power", exercising collective influence <b4_0>in the functional spheres of <a1_0>trade and diplomacy<b4_0/><a1_0/>, as an alternative to military dominance. The European Union is a supranational union and not a sovereign state, and <b5_0>has limited scope in the areas of foreign affairs and defence policy.<b5_0/> These remain largely with the member states of the European Union, which include the <a2_0><b6_0>three<b6_0/><a2_0/> great powers of France, Germany and the United Kingdom (referred to as the "EU three").
